channel.title: A problem in Episode one...
channel.description: I first ran half life 2 episode one after having finished half life 2 on the OB engine. I started up episode one today only to find a Q as my crosshair, I have verifyed my cache files, if anyone has had this problem with the new port of episode one and has a solution I would greatly appreciate it.

item.title: A problem in Episode one...
item.dc:creator: hypnotek
item.description:
But the Q can teach you so much!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kBwoEXlTph0

item.title: A problem in Episode one...
item.dc:creator: Deadline99
item.description:
DON’T GET RID OF IT! HOLD IT AS A SPECIAL MARK OF HONOR, FOR THE HALF LIFE GODS HATH CHOSEN THEE AS ONE OF THE DESCENDANTS OF Q, ALWAYS TO REMEMBER THAT WITHOUT QUAKE, YOU WOULD NEVER HAVE BEEN BORN!

I’m done.

item.title: A problem in Episode one...
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
“Q” is the best letter in the alphabet. Why would you want to get rid of it?

Read full topic

item.title: A problem in Episode one...
item.dc:creator: gordonfreemantshepha
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

are there other half life fonts that you installed in your regular font folder? Believe it or not, there was a half life font I installed, and it caused hud issues. Took me a long time to find the problem but of course I was glad to call myself an idiot but be free of my hud issues.

Its a longshot, but perhaps search all .ttf files delete any valve looking ones… then reverify your cache files?

I did what you said, cats.I deleted all .tff files, and I reverifyed my cache files, and yet I am still met with the enigmatic Q.

Read full topic

item.title: A problem in Episode one...
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
are there other half life fonts that you installed in your regular font folder? Believe it or not, there was a half life font I installed, and it caused hud issues. Took me a long time to find the problem but of course I was glad to call myself an idiot but be free of my hud issues.

Its a longshot, but perhaps search all .ttf files delete any valve looking ones… then reverify your cache files?

item.title: A problem in Episode one...
item.dc:creator: gordonfreemantshepha
item.description:
Payne and Redemption:

In that case, you might want to reinstall the game.

I reinstalled the game, I still have my saved games, so I load a new game on chapter 3, low and behold the enigmatic Q shows up as my crosshair. At that moment I just felt like I wanted to smash my head into my moniter. :’( >

Read full topic

item.title: A problem in Episode one...
item.dc:creator: gordonfreemantshepha
item.description:
Payne and Redemption:

Look in the text files and see if the normal crosshair is missing.

in the resource folder found in “episodic” I found that the only ttf file was called HL2EP1

Read full topic

item.title: A problem in Episode one...

item.description:
Look in the text files and see if the normal crosshair is missing.

item.title: A problem in Episode one...
item.dc:creator: gordonfreemantshepha
item.description:
taxi_evil:

I’ve heard of this problem. Never had it myself, but I’ve read of a fix

Just right-click on episode one and press ‘verify integrity of game cache’

Like I say, never had the problem myself but its worth a bash

If you had read my post you would know that I had said I have already done so, and did so without a successful solution

Read full topic

item.title: A problem in Episode one...
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
I don’t know 100% how to fix it, but I do know that the crosshair is a text font. There’s probably a problem that font has become somehow replaced or corrupted. Might want to check into that.

Read full topic
